column1: pwd$It prints the path of the working directory starting from the root
mkdir$Allows the user to create directories. This command can create multiple directories at once
cp$Used to copy files or group of files or directory
scp$Used to copy file(s) between servers in a secure way
gcc$GNU Debugger tool helps to debug the programs written in C
kill$Used to terminate processes manually. Sends a signal to a process with terminates the process
chmod$Used to change the access mode of a file
chown$Used to change the file owner or group
echo$Used to display line of text/string that are passed as an argument
find$Used to find files and directories and perform subsequent operations on them
ls$Lists the files under the current directory
rmdir$Used to remove empty directories from the filesystem in Linux
mv$Used to move one or more files or directories from one place to another files system like UNIX
man$Used to display the user manual of any command that we can run on the terminal
make$Used to build executable programs and libraries from source code
top$Provides a dynamic real-time view of the running system
cat$Reads data from file and gives their content as output. It helps us to create
df$Used to display information related to file systems about total space and available space
exit$Used to exit the shell where it is currently running
finger$It is a user information lookup command which gives details of all the users logged in
cd$Known as change directory command. It is used to change current working directory
rm$Used to remove objects such as files
column3: symbolic links and so on from the files system like UNIX

column1: ssh$Protocol used to securely connect to a remote server/system
g++$Used for preprocessing compilation
column2: assembly and linking of source code to generate an executable file

column1: ps$Used to list the currently running processes and their PIDs along with some other information depends on different options
who$Used to get information about currently logged in user on to system
alias$Instructs the shell to replace one string with another string while executing the commands
grep$Searches a file for a particulat patter on charcters
column2: and displays all lines that contain that pattern

column1: clear$Used to clear the terminal screen
free$Displays the total amount of free space available along the amount of memory used and swap memory in the system
column2: and also buffers used by the kernel
